cards.name: Dimir Guildgate
cards.text:
Dimir Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.
cards.flavor: In the cold corridors of the undercity, misinformation unfurls from Duskmantle like a spreading stain.

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

ディミーアのギルド門

cards.originalText:

cards.originalText:

Izzet Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.
cards.flavor: Beyond lies the culmination of all Izzet projects, a grand experiment led by the dragon Niv-Mizzet himself.

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

cards.originalText:
Izzet Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Maze's End
cards.text:
Maze's End enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}, Return Maze's End to its owner's hand: Search your library for a Gate card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If you control ten or more Gates with different names, you win the game.

rulings.text: Returning Maze's End to its owner's hand is part of the cost to activate its last ability. Once that ability is announced, players can't respond to it until after you've paid its activation cost and returned Maze's End to hand.

When the last ability of Maze's End resolves, you'll search for a Gate and put it onto the battlefield before checking to see if you win the game. This check will happen even if you don't put a Gate onto the battlefield this way. This check will happen only as the ability resolves, not at other times.

Putting a Gate onto the battlefield with Maze's End doesn't count as the one land you can play during your turn. If it's your turn, you can play Maze's End or a different land card from your hand after its ability has resolved.
Controlling multiple Gates with the same name has no effect on your ability to win the game with Maze's End. The excess Gates are simply ignored.

cards.originalText:
Maze's End enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Return Maze's End to its owner's hand: Search your library for a Gate card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If you control ten or more Gates with different names, you win the game.

cards.name: Orzhov Guildgate
cards.text:
Orzhov Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.
cards.flavor:
"We do not believe in hiding our wealth in the shadows. This is Orzhov, and this is how we reward greatness."
—Teysa Karlov, Grand Envoy of Orzhov

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

cards.originalText:
Orzhov Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

Rakdos Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
cards.flavor: Maze-runners who pass through the Rakdos gate leave behind their scruples and a significant amount of skin.

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

foreignNames.name: Porte de la guilde de Rakdos

cards.originalText:
Rakdos Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

Selesnya Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.
cards.flavor: The Selesyna welcome all to help them heal the city's wounds. The price, however, is devotion to the guild and a selfless belief in Trostani.

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

セレズニアのギルド門

cards.originalText:
Selesnya Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.text:
Simic Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.
cards.flavor: Simic biomancers don't concern themselves with guarding a gate. Their ever-present creations are enough to ward off trespassers.

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

foreignNames.name: Porte de la guilde de Simic

cards.originalText:
Simic Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Home Guard
cards.text: At end of combat, if Kjeldoran Home Guard attacked or blocked this combat, put a -0/-1 counter on Kjeldoran Home Guard and create a 0/1 white Deserter creature token.

rulings.text: The ability will trigger only if Kjeldoran Home Guard is still on the battlefield at end of combat. If it's been dealt lethal combat damage and destroyed during that combat (or has left the battlefield during that combat by any other means), its ability won't trigger and you won't get a token.

You put the Deserter token onto the battlefield even if you can't put a -0/-1 counter on Kjeldoran Home Guard (because it left the battlefield after its ability triggered but before it resolved, for example).

cards.name: Kjeldoran Pride
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
{2}{U}: Attach Kjeldoran Pride to target creature other than enchanted creature.

rulings.text: The activated ability moves this card to a new permanent.

cards.name: Reinforcements
cards.text: Put up to three target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor:
"Let them send their legions! I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild

rulings.text: You have to show which creature cards you put on top of your library, but not the order you put them there.

cards.name: Scars of the Veteran
cards.text:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Scars of the Veteran's mana cost.
Prevent the next 7 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.name: Browse
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Look at the top five cards of your library, put one of them into your hand, and exile the rest.
cards.flavor:
"Once great literature—now great litter."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

cards.name: Lat-Nam's Legacy
cards.text: Shuffle a card from your hand into your library. If you do, draw two cards at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"All the knowledge of Lat-Nam could not protect its sages from the Brothers' War."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen

rulings.text: Shuffling a card from your hand into your library is mandatory. The effect says "if you do" because performing that action might have been impossible. If you fail to shuffle a card into your library because your hand was empty, you won't draw any cards.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Elite Guard
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Kjeldoran Elite Guard. Activate this ability only during combat.
cards.flavor: The winged helms of the Guard are put on for pageants—but taken off for war.

cards.name: Storm Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: Tap target creature with flying.
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: If the exiled card is a snow land, Storm Elemental gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Even though the two activated abilities have the same cost, they're separate. You choose which one you're activating before you exile the top card of your library (and see what it is).
If you activate Storm Elemental's third ability and the exiled card is not a snow land, the ability has no effect.

cards.name: Viscerid Drone
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a Swamp: Destroy target nonartifact creature. It can't be regenerated.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a snow Swamp: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Not all of Terisiare's flooding was natural . . . .

cards.name: Balduvian Dead
cards.text: {2}{R}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 3/1 black and red Graveborn creature token with haste. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the ability is activated during a turn's Ending phase (after any "at the beginning of the End step" triggers would have triggered that turn), the Graveborn token will remain on the battlefield until the following turn's End step.

cards.name: Casting of Bones
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, draw three cards, then discard one of them.
cards.flavor:
"Only a necromancer would create such a foul form of divination."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

cards.name: Insidious Bookworms
cards.text: When Insidious Bookworms dies, you may pay {1}{B}. If you do, target player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
"The so-called Barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the target creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature's power is negative, its controller doesn't lose or gain life.

cards.name: Phantasmal Fiend
cards.text:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.

rulings.text: Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.

Effects that switch power and toughness are always applied last when determining a creature's power and toughness, even if other power/toughness-changing effects are created later in the turn. For example, if you activate Phantasmal Fiend's first ability, it will become 2/4. Then if you activate its second ability, it will become 4/2. Then if you activate its first ability again, it will become 3/3.
Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.name: Binding Grasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Binding Grasp unless you pay {1}{U}.
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1.
cards.flavor:
"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Brainstorm is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.name: Essence Flare
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.
cards.flavor: Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.

rulings.text: The -0/-1 counters stay on the creature even if Essence Flare is removed.

cards.name: Death Spark
cards.text:
Death Spark deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Death Spark is in your graveyard with a creature card directly above it, you may pay {1}. If you do, return Death Spark to your hand.

rulings.text: A card is "directly above" another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later and there are no cards in between the two.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it's put into its owner's graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

Say you're the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that's attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma's Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they're put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it's put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

cards.name: Gorilla Shaman
cards.text: {X}{X}{1}: Destroy target noncreature artifact with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor:
"Frankly, destruction is best left to professionals."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: A tip on how this math works: The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 0 is {0} + {0} + {1} = {1}. The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 1 is {1} + {1} + {1} = {3}. The cost to destroy a noncreature artifact with converted mana cost 2 is {2} + {2} + {1} = {5}. And so on.

cards.name: Iceberg
cards.text:
Iceberg enters the battlefield with X ice counters on it.
{3}: Put an ice counter on Iceberg.
Remove an ice counter from Iceberg: Add {C} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mistfolk
cards.text: {U}: Counter target spell that targets Mistfolk.
cards.flavor:
"Although my official log will state there is no evidence pointing to the existence of the Mistfolk, my certainty is lessened by the cursed consistency of the expedition's eyewitness accounts."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Bounty of the Hunt
cards.text:
You may exile a green card from your hand rather than pay Bounty of the Hunt's mana cost.
Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures. For each +1/+1 counter you put on a creature this way, remove a +1/+1 counter from that creature at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

cards.name: Deadly Insect
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"Beautiful, indeed—but one sting could fell a Giant in a heartbeat."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko,
Elvish Hunter

cards.name: Portent
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: This does not cause a player to lose if they have less than 3 cards in their library. It allows you to look at and reorder or shuffle whatever remaining cards there might be.

cards.name: Snow Devil
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature has first strike as long as it's blocking and you control a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Give me wings to fly and speed to strike. In return, the glory I earn shall be yours."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

cards.name: Zuran Spellcaster
cards.text: {T}: Zuran Spellcaster deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"A mage must be precise as well as potent; cautious, as well as clever."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.name: Ashen Ghoul
cards.text:
Haste
{B}: Return Ashen Ghoul from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if three or more creature cards are above Ashen Ghoul.

rulings.text: A card is "above" another card in your graveyard if it was put into that graveyard later.
Players may not rearrange the cards in their graveyards.
If an effect or rule puts two or more cards into the same graveyard at the same time, the owner of those cards may arrange them in any order.

The last thing that happens to a resolving instant or sorcery spell is that it's put into its owner's graveyard. Example: You cast Wrath of God. All creatures on the battlefield are destroyed. You arrange all the cards put into your graveyard this way in any order you want. The other players in the game do the same to the cards that are put into their graveyards. Then you put Wrath of God into your graveyard, on top of the other cards.

Say you're the owner of both a permanent and an Aura that's attached to it. If both the permanent and the Aura are destroyed at the same time (by Akroma's Vengeance, for example), you decide the order they're put into your graveyard. If just the enchanted permanent is destroyed, it's put into your graveyard first. Then, after state-based actions are checked, the Aura (which is no longer attached to anything) is put into your graveyard on top of it.

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Drift of the Dead
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Drift of the Dead's power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. Risen, they shall serve a new purpose."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Gangrenous Zombies
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Gangrenous Zombies: Gangrenous Zombies deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. If you control a snow Swamp, Gangrenous Zombies deals 2 damage to each creature and each player instead.

rulings.text: Whether it does 1 or 2 damage is checked on resolution.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Dead
cards.text:
When Kjeldoran Dead enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
{B}: Regenerate Kjeldoran Dead.
cards.flavor:
"They shall kill those whom once they loved."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

rulings.text: The sacrifice is a triggered ability and not a cost.
When Kjeldoran Dead's enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, if you don't control any other creatures, you must sacrifice Kjeldoran Dead itself.

cards.name: Legions of Lim-Dûl
cards.text: Snow swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a snow Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"I have seen the faces of my dead friends among that grim band, and I can bear no more."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield.

cards.name: Soul Burn
cards.text:
Spend only black and/or red mana on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {B} spent on X, the player's life total before Soul Burn dealt damage, or the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Will give 1 life for each black mana used, but not more life than the amount of unprevented damage that is dealt.

cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

cards.name: Orcish Healer
cards.text:
{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
{B}{B}{R}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.
{R}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target black or green creature.

cards.name: Orcish Lumberjack
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Add three mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"How did I ever let myself get talked into this project?"
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

cards.name: Aurochs
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
cards.flavor: One Auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

rulings.text: The bonus is not applied until after you check for attack legality, so it is a 2/3 creature when declaring attackers.
The ability counts the number of attacking creatures with the creature type Aurochs, not just those named Aurochs.

cards.name: Tinder Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Tinder Wall deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.

cards.name: Woolly Mammoths
cards.text: Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they're certainly bad to fall off of!"
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Giant Trap Door Spider
cards.text: {1}{R}{G}, {T}: Exile Giant Trap Door Spider and target creature without flying that's attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"So large and so quiet—a combination best avoided."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

rulings.text: If Giant Trap Door Spider leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, the ability will still resolve as normal. The targeted creature will be exiled.

If the targeted creature leaves the battlefield (or otherwise becomes an illegal target) before the ability resolves, the ability will be countered. Giant Trap Door Spider will remain on the battlefield.

cards.name: Wings of Aesthir
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying and first strike.
cards.flavor:
"For those of courage, even the sky holds no limit."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

cards.name: Arcum's Weathervane
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Target snow land is no longer snow.
{2}, {T}: Target nonsnow basic land becomes snow.

rulings.text: Adds the snow or removes the snow supertype to or from a land. Adding snow doesn't overwrite other supertypes.
Can't be used on a dual land to add the Snow Supertype even though it is a basic land subtype. You can use it on any land to remove the snow supertype.

cards.name: Barbed Sextant
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Barbed Sextant: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Skull Catapult
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Let any who doubt the evil of using the ancient devices look at this infernal machine. What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

cards.name: Whalebone Glider
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 3 or less gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It's no Ornithopter, but then I'm no Urza."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Adarkar Valkyrie
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
{T}: When target creature other than Adarkar Valkyrie dies this turn, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: She doesn't escort the dead to the afterlife, but instead raises them to fight and die again.

rulings.text: Adarkar Valkyrie's ability can target a token creature, but since token creatures cease to exist when they leave the battlefield, it won't be returned to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying, vigilance
{T}: When target creature other than Adarkar Valkyrie is put into a graveyard this turn, return that card to play under your control.

cards.name: Boreal Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{S}: Boreal Griffin gains first strike until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor:
"More than snow falls from the Boreal skies."
—Arkin Egilsson, skycaptain

foreignNames.name: ボリアルのグリフィン

cards.originalText:
Flying
{S}: Boreal Griffin gains first strike until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Cover of Winter
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {S} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
If a creature would deal combat damage to you and/or one or more creatures you control, prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of age counters on Cover of Winter.
{S}: Put an age counter on Cover of Winter.

rulings.text: Cover of Winter's replacement effect prevents combat damage creatures would deal to you and to attacking or blocking creatures you control.

If multiple creatures would deal combat damage to you and your creatures at the same time, this prevents X of the damage that would be dealt by each of them. This prevention is applied creature by creature. For example, if Cover of Winter has two age counters and you're being attacked by an unblocked 1/1 and an unblocked 4/4, this will prevent 2 of the combat damage that would be dealt by each one. All damage from the 1/1 is prevented and 2 damage from the 4/4 is prevented, meaning you're dealt 2 damage.
If a creature has double strike, Cover of Winter prevents X of the combat damage it would deal during each combat damage step.

If a creature's combat damage is assigned to multiple recipients (for example, if it has trample and is blocked by two creatures, and damage is assigned to each of those creatures and to you), you decide how to divide the prevention effect. You may prevent damage that would be dealt to the first creature, the second creature, and/or you, as long as the total amount of that creature's damage that would be prevented is X.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {S} ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
If a creature would deal combat damage to you and/or one or more creatures you control, prevent X of that damage, where X is the number of age counters on Cover of Winter.
{S}: Put an age counter on Cover of Winter.

cards.name: Darien, King of Kjeldor
cards.text: Whenever you're dealt damage, you may create that many 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
cards.flavor:
"With his dream of unification fulfilled, Darien became the last king of Kjeldor. Those who followed were known as the kings of New Argive."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

rulings.text: If you're dealt damage that causes your life total to become 0 or less, you lose the game before the tokens can be created.

foreignNames.name: キイェルドーの王、ダリアン

cards.originalText: Whenever you're dealt damage, you may put that many 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Field Marshal
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1 and have first strike. (They deal combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: The Knights of Stromgald struck Darien's Roost from two sides. They would have caught Kjeldor in a pincer attack were it not for Darien's tacticians.
cards.originalText: Other Soldiers get +1/+1 and have first strike.

cards.name: Gelid Shackles
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
{S}: Enchanted creature gains defender until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

rulings.text: Gelid Shackles doesn't stop static abilities or triggered abilities from working. It also won't prevent the creature from attacking unless the enchanted creature is given defender before attackers are declared.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't block and its activated abilities can't be played.
{S}: Enchanted creature gains defender until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Glacial Plating
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {S} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 for each age counter on Glacial Plating.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {S} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it. {S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 for each age counter on Glacial Plating.

cards.name: Jötun Grunt
cards.text: Cumulative upkeep—Put two cards from a single graveyard on the bottom of their owner's library. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

rulings.text: When paying Jötun Grunt's cumulative upkeep, you may choose a different graveyard for each age counter. For example, if it has three age counters on it, you may put four cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library and two cards from your opponent's graveyard on the bottom of their library. However, you can't put five cards from your graveyard on the bottom of your library and one card from your opponent's graveyard on the bottom of their library.

cards.originalText: Cumulative upkeep—Put two cards in a single graveyard on the bottom of their owner's library. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: Jötun Owl Keeper
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {W} or {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Jötun Owl Keeper dies, create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying for each age counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {W} or {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Jötun Owl Keeper is put into a graveyard from play, put a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying into play for each age counter on it.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
Whenever Kjeldoran Gargoyle deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: The gargoyles were taken from the walls of flooded Kjeldoran cities and brought upland to guard the outposts of New Argive.

foreignNames.name: キイェルドーのガーゴイル

cards.originalText:
Flying, first strike
Whenever Kjeldoran Gargoyle deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Javelineer
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Kjeldoran Javelineer deals damage equal to the number of age counters on it to target attacking or blocking creature.

rulings.text: Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

foreignNames.name: キイェルドーの投槍兵

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{T}: Kjeldoran Javelineer deals damage to target attacking or blocking creature equal to the number of age counters on Kjeldoran Javelineer.

cards.name: Kjeldoran Outrider
cards.text: {W}: Kjeldoran Outrider gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I listen to people. He sniffs the wind. And we both sense something big coming. Something very big."
cards.originalText: {W}: Kjeldoran Outrider gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Kjeldoran War Cry
cards.text: Creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 1 plus the number of cards named Kjeldoran War Cry in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: King Darien's breath crystallized and fell to the frozen battlefield, but its command carried true to all soldiers of New Argive.

foreignNames.name: キイェルドーのときの声

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is 1 plus the number of cards named Kjeldoran War Cry in all graveyards.

cards.name: Luminesce
cards.text: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that black and/or red sources would deal this turn.

cards.name: Martyr of Sands
cards.text: {1}, Reveal X white cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Sands: You gain three times X life.
cards.flavor: "Only in our vulnerability is there true power, and that power is life itself."

rulings.text: Each card that's revealed to pay the cost remains revealed until the ability leaves the stack.
A card that's already revealed for another cost or because of an effect can be revealed to pay this cost.
If one of the cards that's revealed to pay the cost leaves its owner's hand before the ability resolves, it stops being revealed, but the value of X is not affected.

cards.originalText: {1}, Reveal X white cards from your hand, Sacrifice Martyr of Sands: You gain three times X life.

cards.name: Ronom Unicorn
cards.text: Sacrifice Ronom Unicorn: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: The aberrant magic of the Rimewind drew the unicorns back from the northern wastes to do battle once again.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Ronom Unicorn: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Squall Drifter
cards.text:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"The scouts claim the cold has malice, and a mind. I begin to believe them. Impassable drifts seem to appear before us at every turn."
—Aevar Borg, northern guide, journal entry
cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Sun's Bounty
cards.text:
You gain 4 life.
Recover {1}{W} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, exile this card.)
cards.flavor: "Heidar has forced the sun into hiding, but it has not forgotten us."
cards.originalText:
You gain 4 life.
Recover {1}{W} (When a creature is put into your graveyard from play, you may pay {1}{W}. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, remove this card from the game.)

cards.name: Sunscour
cards.text:
You may exile two white cards from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Destroy all creatures.

rulings.text: Paying the alternative cost doesn't change when you can cast the spell. A creature spell you cast this way, for example, can still only be cast during your main phase while the stack is empty.
You may pay the alternative cost rather than the card's mana cost. Any additional costs are paid as normal.
If you don't have two cards of the right color in your hand, you can't choose to cast the spell using the alternative cost.
You can't exile a card from your hand to pay for itself. At the time you would pay costs, that card is on the stack, not in your hand.

cards.originalText:
You may remove two white cards in your hand from the game rather than pay Sunscour's mana cost.
Destroy all creatures.

cards.name: Surging Sentinels
cards.text:
First strike
Ripple 4 (When you cast this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may cast any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
cards.originalText:
First strike
Ripple 4 (When you play this spell, you may reveal the top four cards of your library. You may play any revealed cards with the same name as this spell without paying their mana costs. Put the rest on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Swift Maneuver
cards.text:
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor: Darien's call to Yavimaya would have fallen red to the snow had it not been for the agility of the aesthir.
cards.originalText:
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Ursine Fylgja
cards.text:
Ursine Fylgja enters the battlefield with four healing counters on it.
Remove a healing counter from Ursine Fylgja: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ursine Fylgja this turn.
{2}{W}: Put a healing counter on Ursine Fylgja.
cards.originalText:
Ursine Fylgja comes into play with four healing counters on it.
Remove a healing counter from Ursine Fylgja: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ursine Fylgja this turn.
{2}{W}: Put a healing counter on Ursine Fylgja.

cards.name: Wall of Shards
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Cumulative upkeep—An opponent gains 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

rulings.text: When paying Wall of Shards' cumulative upkeep, you may choose a different opponent for each age counter, or you can choose the same opponent multiple times.

Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

cards.originalText:
Defender, flying
Cumulative upkeep—An opponent gains 1 life. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: White Shield Crusader
cards.text:
Protection from black
{W}: White Shield Crusader gains flying until end of turn.
{W}{W}: White Shield Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Honor your steed and it will carry you to great deeds—and bring you home to tell of them."
cards.originalText:
Protection from black
{W}: White Shield Crusader gains flying until end of turn.
{W}{W}: White Shield Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Woolly Razorback
cards.text:
Woolly Razorback enters the battlefield with three ice counters on it.
As long as Woolly Razorback has an ice counter on it, prevent all combat damage it would deal and it has defender.
Whenever Woolly Razorback blocks, remove an ice counter from it.

rulings.text: Having an ice counter on Woolly Razorback doesn't prevent combat damage that would be dealt to it.
The third time Woolly Razorback blocks, its last ice counter will be removed, meaning the combat damage it deals that combat won't be prevented.

cards.originalText:
Woolly Razorback comes into play with three ice counters on it.
As long as Woolly Razorback has an ice counter on it, it has defender and any combat damage it would deal is prevented.
Whenever Woolly Razorback blocks, remove an ice counter from it.

cards.name: Adarkar Windform
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{S}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)
cards.flavor: Terisiare has only two kinds of weather: cold and weird.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{S}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn. ({S} can be paid with one mana from a snow permanent.)

cards.name: Arcum Dagsson
cards.text: {T}: Target artifact creature's controller sacrifices it. That player may search their library for a noncreature artifact card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle their library.
cards.flavor: "Artifice sundered the world. It shall not again wreak such sorrow."

rulings.text: Arcum Dagsson's ability targets an artifact creature, not the controller of one.
Arcum Dagsson's ability can target any permanent that's both an artifact and a creature, such as a Grizzly Bears while Mycosynth Lattice is on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target artifact creature's controller sacrifices it. That player may search his or her library for a noncreature artifact card, put it into play, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.name: Balduvian Frostwaker
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Target snow land becomes a 2/2 blue Elemental creature with flying. It's still a land.
cards.flavor: "Whether frozen or fertile, the land is our ally. It awaits the call to battle."

rulings.text: Balduvian Frostwaker's effect has no duration. The snow land is a creature as long as it's on the battlefield.
If an affected land later loses the supertype snow, Balduvian Frostwaker's effect doesn't end. The land will remain a creature.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

foreignNames.name: バルデュヴィアの霜覚師

cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Target snow land becomes a 2/2 blue Elemental creature with flying. It's still a land.

cards.name: Commandeer
cards.text:
You may exile two blue cards from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Gain control of target noncreature spell. You may choose new targets for it. (If that spell is an artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker, the permanent enters the battlefield under your control.)

rulings.text: If you gain control of an instant or sorcery spell with Commandeer, it will still be put into its owner's graveyard when it resolves.

After Commandeer resolves, you control the targeted spell. Any instance of "you" in that spell's text now refers to you, "an opponent" refers to one of your opponents, and so on. The change of control happens before new targets are chosen, so any targeting restrictions such as "target opponent" or "target creature you control" are now made in reference to you, not the spell's original controller. You may either change those targets to be legal in reference to you, or, if those are the spell's only targets, the spell doesn't resolve for having illegal targets. When the spell resolves, any illegal targets are unaffected by it and you make all decisions the spell's effect calls for.

You may change any of the targeted spell's targets. If you change a target, you must choose a legal target for the spell. If you can't, you must leave the target the same (even if that target is now illegal).
If the targeted spell has a triggered ability that copies it (for example, replicate or storm), the copies will be controlled by the player who cast that spell.
You may pay the alternative cost rather than the card's mana cost. Any additional costs are paid as normal.
If you don't have two cards of the right color in your hand, you can't choose to cast the spell using the alternative cost.
You can't exile a card from your hand to pay for itself. At the time you would pay costs, that card is on the stack, not in your hand.
If you Commandeer a spell for which Buyback has been paid, the card returns to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText:
You may remove two blue cards in your hand from the game rather than pay Commandeer's mana cost.
Gain control of target noncreature spell. You may choose new targets for it. (If that spell is an artifact or enchantment, the permanent comes into play under your control.)
